code: I’m the rulebook of the web, asking for pages and getting replies.
I structure a page, I style it pretty, I make it move.
I shift bits left or right at your command, Changing values without moving my hand. What operator am I?
I live inside curly braces, but I’m not a mustache. I group code together so it runs as one batch. I am a _____.
I check each element one by one until your target is found—or I’m done. What search method am I?
You pass me data, I pass it back. Sometimes I change it, sometimes I just track. But if I point to nothing, you’ll face an error’s wrath. I am a _____.
I store many values under one name, but each value has a key to its fame. Unlike arrays, my keys can be strings. What am I?
I don’t give the whole, just what’s left behind. After division, I show the remainder you’ll find. What operator am I?
I make one type pretend to be another. Numbers to chars, one guise to other. Use me with care, or bugs appear fast. What am I in C?
I skip the rest of this loop’s turn, but keep the loop going to return. What statement am I?
I’m text your program never reads, notes for humans, not machine needs. I am a _____.
Without me, printf and scanf cry. Add me on top and they’ll comply. What line am I?
